summary: The Teacher Loan Forgiveness Enhancement Act amends the Higher Education Act of 1965 to provide undergraduate student loan forgiveness for public school teachers who provide 8 years of consecutive teaching service. It outlines the method of loan forgiveness, defining eligible loans, and stating that the forgiveness amount is not taxable income. The bill also includes provisions for deferment for public school teachers and authorizes disclosure of tax information by the Secretary of the Treasury for the purpose of discharging these loans.
